snippet.title: Olivia Wilde: 'Otis Alexander Sudeikis has LEFT the building! (I'm the building)'
snippet.description: Olivia Wilde and Jason Sudeikis tweet the first picture of their new son, Otis Alexander Sudeikis.

snippet.title: The Supreme Court promises child pornography victims full restitution "someday." How long is that?
snippet.description: The battle for full restitution for child pornography victims will now shift to Congress.

snippet.title: Religion news in brief
snippet.description: Vatican investigators cite two popes' saintly qualities

snippet.title: Bills cheerleaders sue team over wages, "jiggle test"
snippet.description: Raiders, Bengals are also the focus of lawsuits alleging poor payment and mistreatment.

snippet.title: How Medicaid forces the disabled to be poor (but some bipartisan help is on the way).
snippet.description: Medicaid does have one huge flaw, which hurts millions of people living with disabilities, injuries, or chronic illness. Generally, recipients are forbidden from having more than two or three thousand dollars in the bank.

snippet.title: Jet stowaway at hospital as security issues linger
snippet.description: Surveillance cameras at San Jose International Airport successfully recorded the teenager on the tarmac, climbing up the landing gear of a jet. But in the end, the cameras failed because no one noticed the security breach until the plane — and the boy — landed in Hawaii hours later.

snippet.title: A bipolar doctor probes the brain on 'Black Box'
snippet.description: ABC's brainy new medical drama "Black Box" does a neat trick: It dares viewers to imagine for themselves the cost-benefit ratio of addiction, and does it without taking a firm stand.

snippet.title: "I will get the people to buy into my works just to rip their hearts out." A Q&A with a professional Internet troll
snippet.description: For-profit trolling is a booming Internet business. But its ethics, and economics, are cause for concern.

snippet.title: E-cig industry awaits looming federal regulation
snippet.description: Smokers are increasingly turning to battery-powered electronic cigarettes to get their nicotine fix. They're about to find out what federal regulators have to say about the popular devices.

snippet.title: 'The Boondocks' just killed Chris Brown jokes
snippet.description: It appears we may have finally reached the saturation point when it comes to making fun of Chris Brown and his notorious temper.
